p.codeblock: abstract playAllEffects( loopCount: number, pitch: number, pan: number, gain: number, publish?: boolean ): number;
abstract playAllEffects( loopCount: number, pitch: number, pan: number, gain: number, publish?: boolean ): number;
Future<void> playAllEffects( {required int loopCount, required double pitch, required double pan, required int gain, bool publish = false});
public abstract int PlayAllEffects(int loopCount, double pitch, double pan, int gain, bool publish = false);

section.p: After calling multiple times to preload several audio effect files, you can call this method to play all preloaded audio effects.
After calling multiple times to preload multiple audio effect files, you can call this method to play all preloaded audio effect files.
After calling multiple times to preload multiple audio effect files, you can call this method to play all preloaded audio effect files.
After calling multiple times to preload several audio effects, you can call this method to play all preloaded audio effects.

plentry.pd:
The number of times to loop the audio effect:
-1: Loops indefinitely until or is called.
0: Plays the audio effect once.
1: Plays the audio effect twice.
The pitch of the audio effect. Range: [0.5,2.0]. Default is 1.0, which is the original pitch. The smaller the value, the lower the pitch.

The spatial position of the audio effect. Range: [-1.0,1.0]:
-1.0: Audio appears on the left.
0: Audio appears in the center.
1.0: Audio appears on the right.
The volume of the audio effect. Range: [0,100]. 100 is the default and represents the original volume. The smaller the value, the lower the volume.

Whether to publish the audio effect to remote users:
: Publishes the audio effect to remote users. Both local and remote users can hear it.
: (Default) Does not publish the audio effect. Only local users can hear it.

The number of times the audio effect loops:
-1: Loops indefinitely until or is called.
0: Plays the audio effect once.
1: Plays the audio effect twice.
The pitch of the audio effect. The range is [0.5,2.0]. The default value is 1.0, which represents the original pitch. The smaller the value, the lower the pitch.

The spatial position of the audio effect. The range is [-1.0,1.0]:
-1.0: The audio effect appears on the left.
0: The audio effect appears in the center.
1.0: The audio effect appears on the right.
The volume of the audio effect. The range is [0,100]. 100 is the default value, representing the original volume. The smaller the value, the lower the volume.

Whether to publish the audio effect to remote users:
: Publishes the audio effect to remote users. Both local and remote users can hear it.
: (Default) Does not publish the audio effect to remote users. Only local users can hear it.

Number of times the audio effect file is looped:
-1: Loops indefinitely until or is called.
0: Plays once.
1: Plays twice.
Pitch of the audio effect. Value range is [0.5,2.0]. Default is 1.0, which represents the original pitch. The smaller the value, the lower the pitch.

Spatial position of the audio effect. Value range is [-1.0,1.0]:
-1.0: Audio effect appears on the left.
0: Audio effect appears in the center.
1.0: Audio effect appears on the right.
Volume of the audio effect. Value range is [0,100]. 100 is the default and represents the original volume. The smaller the value, the lower the volume.

Whether to publish the audio effect to remote users:
: Publishes the audio effect to remote users. Both local and remote users can hear it.
: (Default) Does not publish the audio effect to remote users. Only local users can hear it.

The number of times the audio effect loops:
-1: Loops indefinitely until or is called.
0: Plays the audio effect once.
1: Plays the audio effect twice.
The pitch of the audio effect. The range is [0.5,2.0]. Default is 1.0, which represents the original pitch. The smaller the value, the lower the pitch.

The spatial position of the audio effect. The range is [-1.0,1.0]:
-1.0: Audio appears on the left.
0: Audio appears in the center.
1.0: Audio appears on the right.
The volume of the audio effect. The range is [0,100]. 100 is the default and represents the original volume. The smaller the value, the lower the volume.

Whether to publish the audio effect to remote users:
: Publishes the audio effect to remote users. Both local and remote users can hear it.
: (Default) Does not publish the audio effect to remote users. Only the local user can hear it.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Method call failed. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
